data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If a person always looks forward, they will always take 10 steps forward before returning to your original place. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes 4 steps to turn around and turn right. So, the answer is yes.

One has to complete all three steps to return to starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

There are 4 steps to return to your starting point. If you take 7 steps and 1 step you take 5 of the 4 steps listed to return to where you started. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn left for 10 steps, take 9 steps and turn left again for 9 steps. Take 3 steps in the first sequence and turn around to get to where you were. Thus, the answer is No.

In the first step, you travel left from the start. Turning right turns you around and you move back to left. Turning right turns you around and you move back to right. So, the answer is No.

Turn around and take 6 steps. Let’ s say, turn around and take 8 steps. Now, to complete the process, we should take 2 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.

No matter the direction you are facing, once you face in any direction, you eventually return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

Take 3 steps to return to starting point. Take 9 steps to take you back to starting point. Take 2 steps to get you back to starting point. Take 7 steps to get you back to starting point. Take 3 steps to get you back to starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Doing these steps will take you back to the starting point. To step right, you first have to turn and take 4 steps left. You can take 4 steps left, take 4 steps forward, or take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

In the first step in the diagram, you’ re facing forward. There are five steps on the left side of the diagram. After taking 5 steps left, you now have 5 steps left to face the right direction. Since all of these actions are taken in reverse, you are now facing the right direction. In order to return to your starting point, you must reverse them. So, the answer is yes.
